alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 11:24AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Okeechobee and southeastern Osceola Counties through NOON EST... At 1124 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Lake Kissimmee to 7 miles northeast of Avon Park to 10 miles southwest of Sebring. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Kissimmee, Basinger, Lake Marian, Kenansville and Kissimmee Prairie Preserve. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for east central Florida.
